_header: If I had wit for to indite
Note:
Composite text ed. Chambers and Sidgwick (1907)
XEdmund Kerchever Chambers, and Frank Sidgwick. Early English Lyrics…. London: Buller, 1907, 1911 et seq, 57; cf. 2360. See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 721.
Title(s): ‘My hart she hath and euer shall’
_description: ‘My hart she hath and euer shall’ — six cross-rhymed quatrains

BLAdd18752.Editions:
Reed,  Ernest Bliss. 
             “The Sixteenth Century Lyrics in Add. MS. 18,752.” 
             Anglia
         33 (1909): 344-69: 350-1.

BLAdd31922.First Lines: Iff I had wytt to endyghtof my lady both fayre and fre…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …happe what wyll happ fall what shallshall no man ut supra
BLAdd31922.Note: Words and notes for the first stanza repeated twice for further singing parts; conclusion of last line from above is “know her name for me.”

BLRoyApp58.First Lines:
[I]ff I hade wytt fore to endyteoff my lady bothe fayre And
                    freeOff hure goodnese then wolde I wreteschall noman know hure name
                    for meshall nomane know hure name for me…
BLRoyApp58.Last Lines:
…My hart she hathe & euer shalltyll by dethe departyd we
                    behap what shall hape wylbe fallshall noman know hure name fore
                    me
